title: 105_hr4685
content: Increased exclusion and modifications for qualified small business stock. Increased exclusion for gain from certain small business stock under section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to 75 percent. Conforming amendments are made to ensure consistency with the new exclusion percentage. The exclusion for gain from certain small business stock under section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is increased to 75 percent. The holding period is reduced from 5 years to 3 years, and the exclusion is now available to corporations. The Code is amended to exclude stock held among members of a controlled group. The minimum tax preference is repealed, and larger businesses' stock is now eligible for exclusion. The Code is amended to exclude stock held among members of a controlled group. Larger businesses' stock is now eligible for exclusion with an increased limit of $300,000,000, subject to inflation adjustments. The Code amendments in 1998 include the repeal of the per-issuer limitation in Section 1202 and modifications to working capital and redemption rules. The amendments made in 1998 include the repeal of the per-issuer limitation in Section 1202 and modifications to working capital and redemption rules. Additionally, a waiver is provided for stock purchases by the issuing corporation if a business purpose is established. The effective dates for these amendments apply to stock issued after the date of enactment of the Act. The amendments made in 1998, including the repeal of the per-issuer limitation in Section 1202 and modifications to working capital and redemption rules, apply to stock issued after August 10, 1993. SEC. 2 increases the exclusion for incentive stock options from $100,000 to $200,000 per year and exempts them from the alternative minimum tax. These changes apply to options exercised in calendar years after the enactment of the Act.
